channel.title: Xp
channel.description: When I installed xp i made a new drive for it it was called F: or w/e but it has only 15 mb of ram on it i wanted to overwrite the c: drive but now when i start comp it says which operation system you want to start ect. Now I assume the first one that says windows xp home edition is the F: Drive i am right as when i click it it has my current programs the other 2 are ones i haven't installed windows on yet so is the second option the C: Drive?

item.title: Xp
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

15mb of ram, lmfao.

Read full topic

item.title: Xp
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

Boot from an XP disk and try a chkdsk /r on the installation, or repair XP on C by skipping the first repair and repairing at the second option, again if that doesnt work, install XP to a different directory C:/winxp maybe?.

Read full topic

item.title: Xp
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

… What? I would read up on what your trying to do and then come back here once we can make some sense of your post.

Read full topic

item.title: Xp
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Your post makes no sense at all!

Reformat your whole HD and parition it properly.
XP normally recogises the first primary partition as C:/

Read full topic
